definition: to expel poison (from the system)/to detox
a row/a line/to set in order/to arrange/to line up/to eliminate/to drain/to push open/platoon/raft/classifier for lines, rows etc

sentences.english: And if you sleep at 2am, you only have 1 hour to detoxify.

sentences.english: In addition, the bamboo salt of far infrared radiation of poison also has.

sentences.english: Neither are there many studies to say that guzzling water will prevent headaches or flush toxins from your body.
sentences.chinese: 也沒有研究表明過量飲水可以防止頭痛或排毒。

sentences.english: They can detox program in seven days after the intake of milk dairy products.
sentences.chinese: 大可以在七天牛奶排毒計畫後開始攝取奶類製品。

sentences.english: In the days of detox, you'd better not to drink the kind of motile beverage in the market.
sentences.chinese: 市場上的運動型飲料，在排毒的幾天裏最好不要飲用。

sentences.english: Fasting cleans and detoxifies our body.
sentences.chinese: 齋戒能潔淨我們的身體並幫助排毒。

sentences.english: Anti-drying, to wrinkles, promote diaphoretic to prevent obstruction skin, and assist detoxification.

sentences.english: Lingzhi Detox Tea slimming effect with the double.

sentences.english: Even an iced tea drink can help in detoxifying the body.
sentences.chinese: 甚至一冰鎮茶飲料可以幫助在排毒身體。

sentences.english: The activity is healthy, environment friendly, and worth spreading. O yeah.
sentences.chinese: 該活動低炭減肥排毒養顏，值得推廣。

sentences.english: So I'm getting symptoms from detoxing.
Many people have made it a rule to detoxify once a year.
sentences.chinese: 許多人已經養成了每年進行一次身體排毒的習慣。

sentences.english: Coffee will detox your liver in surprising ways.
sentences.chinese: 咖啡可以協助肝臟排毒。

sentences.english: Partly, but also as you suspect, increased detoxing.
sentences.chinese: 部分，但仍像你猜測的那樣，增加排毒。

sentences.english: Detoxifies the skin and tighten pores.

definition: to drain (factory waste etc)/to excrete (urine, sweat etc)
to nourish one's skin/to maintain a youthful appearance
to nurse one's health/to recuperate/to take care of/to look after/to discipline/to educate/to train/to prepare food/(dialect) to make fun of/(medicine) to opsonize
